title: Who are some K-pop idols turned YouTubers? - Quora

response.answer_text: I can't quite remember whether she made it as a proper idol. But there is a youtuber called GRAZYTV. She was on the show ‘Unpretty Rapstar’ and had a few music videos from the show aswell I believe. She still release some music now but she's not under any label I believe. Her content is based generally around life in South Korea such as what not to do when visiting, social customs, pros and cons of living in South Korea aswell as alot of good advice for foreign women to keep in mind when visiting the country. She also posts a few videos of her experiences as a trainee. She never mentions which companies she used to be under however she does spill lots of tea. And has made some videos with former Produce48 contestant Alex (Who has now debuted as Alexa) and an ex-idol who's name has slipped my mind 😅. She also made a tea video with the first ever African-American Kpop idol Alex Ried.

Here is another another k-pop idol that became a YouTubeer. Her channel is called soobeanie_ https://www.youtube.com/c/soobeanie In her channel she talks about her experience in the industry and various things in her daily life in Korea, her hobbies and other things.  She was a nember of former k-pop idol group Blady that was sadly disbanded after 2 years after not gaining sufficient popularity. She is Tina of Blady. The songs of the group were catchy and fun to watch.    And now she became a YouTuber and is a friend with another k-pop YouTuber, Gracy Grace. They have some videos together.
